meanings.definition: To be a companion to someone.
meanings.sent1: She companioned her friend during the long journey.
meanings.sent2: The dog companioned the little girl wherever she went.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear companioned the lonely child, bringing comfort.
meanings.sent4: His loyal dog companioned him through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The cheerful robin companioned the old man on his daily walks.

meanings.sent1: They companioned each other through good times and bad.
meanings.sent2: The elderly couple companioned peacefully in their cozy home.
meanings.sent3: The cat companioned the curious kitten, showing it around the house.
meanings.sent4: The stars companioned the moon in the night sky, creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture companioned the stranger, making them feel welcomed.
